meanings.definition: The quality of being caustic or corrosive.
meanings.sent1: The causticity of the chemical was evident in its ability to eat through metal.
meanings.sent2: The causticity of the acid was so strong that it dissolved the entire container.
meanings.sent3: The causticity of her words left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent4: The causticity of his criticism burned through her confidence like acid.
meanings.sent5: The causticity of the situation was like a sharp knife cutting through the air.

meanings.definition: The ability to burn or corrode organic tissue.
meanings.sent1: The causticity of the chemical burn was severe and left a lasting mark.
meanings.sent2: The causticity of the acid on his skin caused immediate pain and redness.
meanings.sent3: The causticity of the hot coffee spilled on her hand made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The causticity of the situation was like a fiery dragon breathing on his skin.
meanings.sent5: The causticity of the substance was like a tiny flame slowly eating away at the fabric.

meanings.definition: The harshness or severity of a remark or criticism.
meanings.sent1: The causticity of his comment stung more than he intended.
meanings.sent2: The causticity of her words left a lingering feeling of hurt in the room.
meanings.sent3: The causticity of the joke was lost on him, and he laughed heartily.
meanings.sent4: The causticity of their argument was like a storm brewing in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The causticity of the feedback was like a sharp slap to his ego.
